taskbody.context: To set up qTest integration with manually, follow these steps:

step.cmd: In the Authentication section, select your qTest version.
step.info: We recommend selecting 7 or higher. This is because earlier versions might be deprecated soon.

step.cmd: To generate a token for authentication, you can choose either log in with username and password or with an SSO token.

p.b: Log in with username and password

li.p: Click Generate. The Generate new token dialog opens.

image.alt: Log in with username and password

li.p: Fill in your qTest account information. Then click Generate.
connects to qTest using the provided information. The token is generated.
If you are using Single Sign-On (SSO) to log in to qTest, ignore the Generate button, copy and paste the following token format in the Token text field:

p.codeblock: {"access_token":"<bearer_token_value>","token_type":"bearer","scope":"read write create delete administration execute import export share baseline"}

li.p: To find the <bearer_token_value>, access qTest Manager. Sign in with your SSO account. Navigate to the Download qTest Resources page. In the API & SDK section, you can see the Bearer Token value.

step.cmd: Select your preferred test submission method from the following options:

row.entry: Results of executed test cases are uploaded automatically to qTest.
Submit test run result to the latest approved version
Test run results are submitted to the latest approved version of the mapped qTest test case.
Additional attachments for reports to be upload to qTest. These report formats only apply to test suites. To learn more about test suite and test suite collection reports, see .

step.cmd: To conduct test case mapping, follow these steps:

substep.cmd: To create mappings between qTest modules and Katalon test case folders, go to Project > Settings > Plugins > qTest > Test Case Repositories.

image.alt: Map Katalon test case in manual setup

substep.cmd: Click Add. The Create Test Case Repository dialog opens.
Choose your qTest project and module, then browse the Katalon folder containing the test case you wish to map with.
Click OK when you are done.

image.alt: Map test cases between qTest and KS

step.cmd: To conduct test suites mapping, follow these steps:

substep.cmd: To create mappings between qTest projects and Katalon test suite folders, go to Project > Settings > Plugins > qTest > Test Suite Repositories.

image.alt: Map test suites in Katalon Studio

substep.cmd: Click Add. The Create Test Suite Repository dialog opens.
Choose your qTest project, and browse the Katalon folder for the test suite you wish to map with.
Click OK when you are done.

image.alt: Map qTest test suites with Katalon Studio

li.p: You should select test suites that contain test cases defined in the Test Case Repositories settings.
